cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles WNW of Nassau and 180 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest through the north-western Bahamas, then turning north-northwest paralleling or crossing Florida’s east coast and moving up the southeast U.S. coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or along Florida’s east coast (around the West Palm Beach–Cape Canaveral corridor)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Edisto Beach, SC to South Santee River, SC; Tropical Storm Watch north of Chokoloskee to Anclote River, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning north of Golden Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC including Lake Okeechobee and the central & north-western Bahamas; Tropical Storm Warning Chokoloskee to Golden Beach, FL including Florida Keys, Florida Bay, and Anclote River to Suwannee River, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and north-western Bahamas and the U.S. southeast Atlantic coastline from Florida through South Carolina
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: N/A (cyclone already well west-northwest of Puerto Rico)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None listed for Puerto Rico in advisory table
weather_observation.wind: No tropical-storm-force winds expected at San Juan, PR during the next 5 days.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only typical trade-wind showers; no heavy rainfall directly attributable to Hurricane Matthew.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and dangerous rip currents along north-facing Puerto Rico beaches possible.
